economiccomplexity 0.2.4
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • How to use this package

Proximity

proximity.Rd

proximity computes proximity

proximity(rca, diversity, ubiquity, country_r = "country",
  product_r = "product", value_r = "value", country_d = "country",
  value_d = "value", product_u = "product", value_u = "value",
  tbl = TRUE, compute = "both")

Arguments

rca

matrix or data.frame with RCA values
diversity

matrix or data.frame with diversity values
ubiquity

matrix or data.frame with ubiquity values
country_r

column containing countries (applies only if d is a data.frame)
product_r

column containing products (applies only if d is a data.frame)
value_r

column containing traded values (applies only if d is a data.frame)
country_d

column containing countries (applies only if d is a data.frame)
value_d

column containing values (applies only if d is a data.frame)
product_u

column containing products (applies only if d is a data.frame)
value_u

column containing values (applies only if d is a data.frame)
tbl

TRUE (default) returns a data.frame and FALSE returns a matrix
compute

"country", "product" or "both" (default) matrices

Value

A list with two data frames or matrices.

References

For more information on proximity and its applications see:

Hausmann R, Hidalgo C, Bustos S, Coscia M, Simoes A, Yildirim M (2014). The atlas of economic complexity: Mapping paths to prosperity. MIT Press. doi: 10.7551/mitpress/9647.001.0001 .

and the references therein.

See also

rca, complexity

Examples

proximity(
  rca = ec_output_demo$rca_tbl,
  d = ec_output_demo$complexity_measures_tbl$diversity,
  u = ec_output_demo$complexity_measures_tbl$ubiquity
)
